messages.message:
Has anyone else had problems `make build-thrift`. I’m seeing these errors. I’m in a python 3.7 venv. Not sure if it has anything to do with that Python.framework/Versions/3.6/… bit, but I’m not sure how to change that:
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/heymian/src/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/../../../shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/scripts/gen_thrift.py", line 760, in <module>
    main()
  File "/Users/heymian/src/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/../../../shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/scripts/gen_thrift.py", line 747, in main
    _create_thrift_mypy_stub(args)
  File "/Users/heymian/src/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/../../../shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/scripts/gen_thrift.py", line 610, in _create_thrift_mypy_stub
    python_binary_path, use_py3)
  File "/Users/heymian/src/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/../../../shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/scripts/gen_thrift.py", line 597, in _run_stubgen
    raise IOError(u'Error when running stubgen {}'.format(err))
OSError: Error when running stubgen b'Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/bin/stubgen", line 7, in <module>\n    from mypy.stubgen import main\n  File "mypy/stubgen.py", line 59, in <module>\n  File "mypy/build.py", line 35, in <module>\n  File "mypy/nodes.py", line 9, in <module>\nAttributeError: module \'mypy_extensions\' has no attribute \'trait\'\n'```
I believe mypy comes with stubgen installed already
i think the problem is that your “stubgen” refers to a stubgen installed in Python3.6 which probably no longer exists, and you’re using Python 3.7

when i do “which stubgen” i get:

/Users/davidlluncor/GitHub/venv-instabase37/bin/stubgen
if your stubgen points to something else, I think you need to reinstall your mypy, and make sure that “python” refers to Python 3.7 in your virtualenv
from your Python 3 virtualenv, then hopefully your stubgen is pointing to a location inside your Python3.7 venv

ah if i do `which stubgen` i get:
`/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/bin/stubgen`
